DOC.brief_title: Evaluating Link Between Neighborhood Environments Obesity Among African American Women
DOC.detailed_description: Obesity , lead high rate diabetes , cancer , heart disease , increasingly important public health problem . In 2000 , 78 % African American woman overweight , 50 % obese . Several factor contribute obesity , include genetics , diet , environmental factor . Individuals live environment difficult maintain active lifestyle prone obesity . The Black Women 's Health Study ( BWHS ) extensive long-term study gather data woman across country examine occurrence various disease among African American woman . Using BWHS study data specific information participant ' neighborhood , include street layout presence sidewalk , study determine neighborhood environment influence prevalence obesity among African American woman . This study use already-collected data physical activity body mass index BWHS study participant live New York , Los Angeles , Chicago ; additional study visit specifically study . A transportation urban planning expert compile data regard pedestrian environment neighborhood three city , include nature density land use , proximity park , presence sidewalk , speed volume traffic , street structure . Census data regard participant ' socioeconomic status also collect .
DOC.criteria: Participating BWHS study Residing New York , Los Angeles , Chicago
